legacy.full_text: Pleased to be an Australian voice today at the @CCG_org Global Think Tank forum in Beijing. Lots of North American and European representation, less so Asia and Oceania. Great being back in town after a four year Covid-induced break. @UTSEngage https://t.co/oQeZpwTE0e

Good on @CCG_org for getting the video of the recent global think-tank forum in Beijing online so promptly. My remarks are at 1:52.  https://t.co/79zBIv4Sab Great opportunity to also catch up with @ZichenWanghere, @yangliuxh and others.

legacy.name: Yang Liu

result.text:
Here's a statement given to me by @Baidu_Inc Maps, regarding the previous media attention over its labeling of #Palestine and #Israel: 

“Where space is limited, our maps may not display the names or flags of some territories. Users can find corresponding countries or areas on Baidu Maps by simply using the map’s search function.”

My personal take is that whatever the reason is, it should be a technical reason, instead of a political one. Overreading the practice of a commercial company can be misleading.

legacy.full_text:
🧵
China is registering historically warm weather, a breakdown:
1. 11 provinces have registered the hottest temperature recorded in Nov on Wed.
2. 705 (30%) nation-level weather stations recorded record-breaking or tying temperatures in Nov. https://t.co/TDWaJBuFDT

legacy.description: @xhnews, Xinhua Institute, previously in Damascus/Washington. Usual disclaimers. Sign up for my newsletter @Beijingchannel, focusing on China's foreign affairs↓
legacy.name: Yang Liu

legacy.full_text:
3. The Northern provinces of Hebei and Shandong recorded 30 °C in Nov. for the first time in history.
4. 7 provincial capitals broke the record for highest temperature in Nov. 
5. Ji'nan, capital of Shandong, is 10 degrees higher than normal./2

legacy.description: @xhnews, Xinhua Institute, previously in Damascus/Washington. Usual disclaimers. Sign up for my newsletter @Beijingchannel, focusing on China's foreign affairs↓
legacy.name: Yang Liu

legacy.full_text:
6. Current cool air in the NE/Xinjiang is unlikely to drive away the heat. Jilin's capital Changchun may see a 20-degree rise on Nov. 2, more record-breaking temp can't be ruled out.
7. The NE region may see big temp fluctuations in the next week.
https://t.co/LLJq0tUUXk /End

legacy.description:
Spokesperson of Chinese Embassy in the U.S.

Youtube: https://t.co/kzg8yLQusb
Facebook: https://t.co/1jkEqRwr4T
TikTok: https://t.co/Ms14dJhMEp
legacy.name: Liu Pengyu 刘鹏宇

result.text: VP Han Zheng met with a delegation of Flying Tigers veterans on Oct. 30. Han said more than 80 years ago, China and the U.S. fought side by side against fascism, and the story of the Flying Tigers bears the profound friendship forged with the lives and blood of the two peoples. Noting that many major challenges in today's world still need to be met together by the two countries, he expressed the hope that the spirit of the Flying Tigers would be passed on from generation to generation.

🧵
The Ministry of State Security said it's cracked down on illegal meteorological monitoring devices feeding data to foreign parties. https://t.co/wP7ckUrka2

legacy.description: @xhnews, Xinhua Institute, previously in Damascus/Washington. Usual disclaimers. Sign up for my newsletter @Beijingchannel, focusing on China's foreign affairs↓
legacy.name: Yang Liu

legacy.full_text: The instruments are small, easy to install, and hard to detect, their operation and transmitted data were not approved by the Chinese gov't and did not supply the Chinese gov't with data. /4
